label: 滝口
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 2:  Heian Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1999
説明文: Established in 890 by Emperor Uda to protect himself from the deposed and dangerously hostile emperor Yōzei.  Its members were non-nobles of the Sixth Rank attached to the Chamberlains' Office (kurōdodokoro), in the late Heian period the appointments becoming hereditary in warrior lines of the Taira and Minamoto clans (pp. 680-681). [宇多天皇、陽成天皇、蔵人所、平、源]
